title: China slams two Japanese right-wingers' landing on Diaoyu Islands
description: Two Japanese right-wing activists landed on one islet of the Diaoyus in the East China Sea Thursday morning in defiance of the coastguard’ warnings, a Japanese official said Friday.
cleanContent: By Mei Jingya, Sina EnglishTwo Japanese right-wing activists landed on one islet of the Diaoyus in the East China Sea Thursday morning in defiance of the coastguard’ warnings, a Japanese official said Friday.One of the two Japanese nationals is Hitoshi Nakama, a local politician from Ishigaki, Okinawa. He and another person reportedly dived into the sea from a fishing boat and reached the island.China Foreign Ministry spokesman Liu Weimin said in Friday’s regular press briefing that the two Japanese’ Diaoyu landing has violated China’s sovereignty, and that China has lodged a complaint to the Japanese side.Related:A fishing boat carrying nine Taiwanese activists sailed near the Diaoyu Islands in the East China Sea and entered 'Japanese waters' Wednesday morning, Japan's Kyodo News Agency reported today, citing Japan Coast Guard officials.																																																																								|  |
